channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: I Can’t Find Tenants! Should I Sell or Lower My Rent?
item.description: Your rental properties are sitting vacant—what do you do? Do you sell or lower your rent price to spark some interest? Will reducing your rent open you up to bad […]

item.title: Here’s everything Apple announced at the WWDC 2024 keynote, including Apple Intelligence, Siri makeover
item.description: The TechCrunch team runs down all of the biggest news from the Apple WWDC 2024 keynote in an easy-to-skim digest. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Takeaways From Our Series on St. Louis Homicide Investigations
item.description: The police department has struggled to solve homicides, partly due to shoddy detective work, staffing shortages and eroding community trust.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: My Property Manager Robbed and Ghosted Me ($40K Stolen!)
item.description: If you get your property management wrong, you could lose tens of thousands of dollars. A sketchy property manager could take all your rent and run, leaving you with the […]

item.title: TechCrunch Space: A week that will go down in history
item.description: Hello and welcome back to TechCrunch Space. What a week! In the same seven-day period, we watched Boeing’s Starliner launch astronauts to space for the first time, and then we got to watch those two astronauts dock with the International Space Station. And we also got to see SpaceX launch Starship for the fourth time […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Were in a Mental Health Crisis at a Hospital. This Is How They Landed in Jail.
item.description: In Washington, like most states, laws intended to protect health care workers are leading to prosecutions of people with severe mental illness.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: You Are Prone to Errors—Avoid These 5 Scientifically Proven Mental Traps When Making Investment Decisions
item.description: A standard economics textbook depicts humans as rational beings who always employ careful analysis to make the most advantageous decisions based on the costs and benefits of the available options. […]

item.title: Elon Musk threatens to ban Apple devices from his companies over Apple’s ChatGPT integrations
item.description: Elon Musk's posts seem to misunderstand the relationship Apple announced with OpenAI at WWDC 2024. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Why Some States are Trying to Get People Medicaid Before They Leave Prison
item.description: People leaving prisons and jails are at greater risk of illness and death, but for years they couldn’t use the government health insurance program.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: 14 Cities With the Highest Risk of Storm Damage This Hurricane Season—How Can You Protect Your Property?
item.description: Hurricane season has started, and forecasts are not looking good. According to analytics company CoreLogic, more than 32.7 million homes from Texas to Maine are at risk of hurricane damage […]

item.title: Apple confirms plans to work with Google’s Gemini ‘in the future’
item.description: “We’re looking forward to doing integrations with other models, including Google Gemini, for instance, in the future," Federighi said during WWDC 2024. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: St. Louis Homicide Cases Often Go Unsolved. Victims’ Families Want Justice.
item.description: These St. Louis families have waited years for answers. They say police seem to have forgotten their loved ones.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: The 5 Most Expensive Investment Property Losses—Plus Damage Estimates and Mitigation Tips
item.description: According to the Insurance Information Institute, about one in 20 insured homes file a claim each year. And while some perils that cause the costliest damage are unavoidable, such as hurricanes, many can be mitigated through proactive measures.

item.title: How Urvashi Barooah broke into venture after everyone told her she couldn’t
item.description: When Urvashi Barooah applied to MBA programs in 2015, she focused her applications around her dream of becoming a venture capitalist. She got rejected from every school, and was told she was being unrealistic about her prospects in the venture industry — but she didn’t let that deter her. Now, nine years later, Barooah, 33, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: As Murders Increased, St. Louis Police Struggled for Resources to Solve Cases
item.description: The city’s homicide unit has dealt with short staffing, long hours and a ballooning DNA backlog.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
